benchmark_details.name: StereoBias
benchmark_details.overview: The StereoBias dataset is labeled for bias and stereotype detection across five categories: religion, gender, socio-economic status, race, profession, and others, enabling a deeper study of their relationship.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective is to improve bias detection in AI models by leveraging stereotype detection as a complementary task.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: While the study presents promising results, it is limited to models with parameter sizes up to 8B, and the cultural background of annotators may have influenced the annotation process.

data.source: Curated using sentences from StereoSet and CrowS-Pairs datasets.
data.annotation: Annotated by three independent annotators based on detailed guidelines.

methodology.calculation: F1 scores are calculated to evaluate the performance of bias and stereotype classification.
methodology.interpretation: Higher Macro-F1 scores indicate better performance in detecting bias and stereotypes.
methodology.baseline_results: Encoder-only models achieved competitive scores with RoBERTa-large reaching a maximum of 0.7742 F1 for bias detection.
methodology.validation: Validation of results using cross-validation and statistical hypothesis testing.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset includes demographic breakdowns across various groups.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All datasets were pre-processed to anonymize and protect personally identifiable information.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: The study ensures ethical usage of datasets.
